svg.title: digital signatures comprehensive
svg.text: üìù Definition: Digital signatures are cryptographic mechanisms that verify authenticity, integrity, and non-repudiation of digital documents
üîê Technology: Uses asymmetric cryptography - private key for signing, public key for verification
‚öñÔ∏è Legal Value: Legally recognized in many jurisdictions as equivalent to handwritten signatures
üõ°Ô∏è Security: Provides strong cryptographic evidence of document origin and prevents tampering detection
